headline: Rio+20 People's summit  in pictures
text: 18 June: A man walks past a banner at the entrance of the of the Brazil Pavilion Photograph: Nacho Doce/Reuters       18 June: Indigenous men stand still in downtown Rio de Janeiro, during a protest against the Brazilian development bank for financing hydroelectric power plants Photograph: Antonio Scorza/AFP/Getty Images       18 June: Women march holding a banner that reads in Portuguese; 'Women's World March' in a rally for women's rights  Photograph: Felipe Dana/AP       18 June: Executive director of UN women, Chilean former president Michelle Bachelet (right) smiles while accompanied by Norwegian former prime minister Gro Harlem Brundtland (left) during a press conference  Photograph: Marcelo Sayao/EPA       18 June: Indigenous people squeeze into a subway train as they ride to the People's summit  Photograph: Felipe Dana/AP       18 June: An indigenous man and thousands of activists from the 'Movimiento de los Sin Tierra', or Landless Workers' Movement, 'La Via Campesina', or International Peasant Movement, and other sectors of society march against the capitalist green economy and demand a sustainable economy Photograph: ANTONIO LACERDA/EPA       17 June: People take part in an inter-religious wake during the People's summit  Photograph: Vanderlei Almeida/AFP/Getty Images       17 June: Rio de Janeiro's mayor, Eduardo Paes, left, shakes hands with Indigenous leader Marcos Terena as they meet at the Cacique de Ramos samba school  Photograph: Felipe Dana/AP       17 June: Indigenous men from Terena tribe dance at Kari-Oca village in Rio de Janeiro  Photograph: RICARDO MORAES/REUTERS       17 June: Children play with a giant globe in Flamengo park Photograph: VANDERLEI ALMEIDA/AFP/Getty Images       17 June: Activists hold up a banner depicting a $1 trillion note dripping with oil on Copacana beach  Photograph: Stringer/Reuters       17 June: A man plays a flute as people line up at the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior in the harbor of Rio de Janeiro Photograph: Marcelo Sayao/EPA       17 June: Indigenous people camp during exhibitions in Jacarepagua, Rio de Janeiro Photograph: ANDRE DURAO/AFP/Getty Images       16 June: Young people rest at camp Quinta da Boa Vista, the venue for representatives of social movements attending the People's summit Photograph: Marcelo Sayao/EPA       16 June: A fictitious favela in Copacabana beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Photograph: Antonio Lacerda/EPA       16 June: Bianca Jagger, ambassador for the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Plant a Pledge campaign (left) and Mauricio Ruiz, environmentalist from Terra Institute of Environmental preservation (ITPA) plant a king tree in an Atlantic forest area as part of a reforestation project   Photograph: Felipe Dana/AP       16 June: An indigenous man paints the arm of a tourist  Photograph: Antonio Lacerda/EPA       15 June: Brazil's former president and current senator, Fernando Collor de Mello (right) talks as Brazil's foreign minister Antonio Patriota (centre) and Sha Zukang, secretary-general of Rio +20 Photograph: Ricardo Moraes/Reuters       15 June: Students look inside a traditional house during a visit at Kari-Oca village in Rio de Janeiro Photograph: Ricardo Moraes/Reuters       14 June: A woman and her daughter visit a light room as part of one of the Project Future exhibitions Photograph: Antonio Lacerda/EPA       14 June: Indigenous people from Xavante tribe attend the first indigenous assembly on Rio +20 Conference at Kari-Oca village Photograph: Ricardo Moraes/Reuters       13 June: People watch an exhibition in the TEDxRio+20 forum at the Copacabana Fort  Photograph: Stringer/Reuters       13 June: Indigenous men from several tribes participate in the sacred fire lighting ceremony at the Kari-Oca village Photograph: Felipe Dana/AP       13 June: Indigenous people attend a fire ceremony Photograph: Marcelo Sayao/EPA       13 June: Brazilian President Dilma
